Jadartis.name: Jadartis
description: @+Jadartis+@ is an archfey that resides in the Realm of Spring in the Feywild.

Elvyre.name: Elvyre

Gyllenae.name: Gyllenae
description: @+Gyllenae+@ is an archfey that resides in the Realm of Summer in the Feywild. She is one of the most ancient and powerful fey in existence. It is unclear the extent of her power, and some followers consider her a god, or demi-god of nature in her own right. This has led many religious scholars who become aware of her existence to question her relationship with the Sage, with some postulating that she might even be the Sage herself, an avatar of the goddess, or possibly that the two are in conflict over the dominion of nature.

Goals and Schemes: As the monarch of the Summer Court, the Summer Queen's obligation is to defend her vassals – including all of the other Seelie Archfey (Spring and Summer) – from the Prince of Frost and the Unseelie (Autumn and Winter). Many problems between the Courts escalate to the point of her intervention.

Truth and beauty are her greatest ideals. "Mortals should be free of influence", however is not one of them. She concludes that a beautiful relic in the hands of a repugnant person is a wrong that needs righting. To separate the two, she opens with persuasion, but fey persuasion is inextricable from magical might.

When she encounters a mortal that captures here interest, she will often orchestrate a trial for them, which ends with the discovery of a great, often dangerous, secret. This can often come in the form of a fey in mortal guise who apparently requires saving.

Neráida.name: Neráida
description: @+Neráida+@ is an archfey that resides in the Realm of Summer in the Feywild.

Xanyth.name: Xanyth
description: @+Xanyth+@ is an archfey that resides in the Realm of Winter in the Feywild. He is the monarch of the Unseelie, the fey of Autumn and Winter. Fear and passion guide the Unseelie as much as truth and beauty do the Seelie. The Lord of Frost rules the fey for half the year, but finds the transfer of power back to his counterpart even more objectionable than the Summer Queen does. While the Seelie are more invested in the high and courtly traditions, the Unseelie prize ambition and will engage in treachery when it suits their needs.

Goals and Schemes: The Lord's primary goal is to convince mortals that he is the true, benevolent ruler of the fey. Any who capture his attention are treated as welcome guests and ensnared in his charming, yet terrifying, company. Those who reject him or seek to uncover the true, cruel nature are cast out, and become the subject of bitter revenge.

The Lord of Frost profits by dividing his enemies and setting them against one another. This could be as simple as telling mortals of the powerful magic items that a Seelie fey possess, or something impossibly byzantine involving capturing three stable-boys (one of which has a latent sorcerous talent), invoking the curse of deadly nightshade on the princess whose parents snubbed His Darkly Imperious Majesty, or leading mortals into the Feywild simply to delight in their terror upon realizing they have been trapped in the Wild Lands.

While cruel, the Lord of Frost is not overly evil. He does good in his own, chaotic way. He is more than happy to take in young children who arrive in his realm unannounced, alone and frightened, and teach them the ways of fey so that they might act as his agents in the future.
